intro: Saussurea salemanni, commonly known as the Himalayan ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, spindly stems and small, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant is adapted to cold, arid environments and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Due to its remote habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
